image.altText: a group of people standing in front of a house at night

props.synopsis: The family of Alice Springs man Gach Top have found him alive near an Aboriginal homeland a week after he was reported missing and days after the official search was called off.

title.children: Missing Alice Springs man found by family in 'miracle' after police called off search

image.altText: A young girl lies with her head down in front of flower tributes.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Police say the cause of Kumanjayi White's death remains "undetermined", more than two months after he died in police custody at a Coles supermarket in Alice Springs.

title.children: Police say Kumanjayi White's cause of death remains 'undetermined'

image.altText: A man in traditional dress.

props.synopsis: Like their Yol≈ãu hosts on Gumatj country, the stories, dance and regalia of Navajo, Comanche, Kiowa Sioux, Pueblo and Lakota nations in North America are intertwined with the land and natural environment.

title.children: In the red sand, two ancient cultures collide

image.altText: An airplane on the runway

props.synopsis: Nexus says the route linking Broome and Kununurra in the Kimberley with the Northern Territory's capital has become "financially unsustainable".

title.children: Calls for flight route to be regulated after Nexus pulls out

image.altText: A woman in a t-shirt stands in front of a quick-flowing river in the remote Northern Territory.

props.synopsis: Scientists say one of the Northern Territory's most important water systems is experiencing "significant depletion".

title.children: NT's vast Cambrian Limestone Aquifer 'getting drier', research finds

image.altText: A young woman with long blonde wavy hair, red t-shirt, blurred greenery in the background, sun hitting back of her head

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory has the highest rate of sexual violence in Australia, with experts warning there's been a steep increase in children presenting with harmful sexualised behaviours.¬†

title.children: The NT has the nation's highest rate of sexual violence, and it's worsening

image.altText: A woman with long grey hair wearing a denim jacket looks at paperwork in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: Melanie and David Moor spent their life savings building a home on a newly subdivided block in Victoria. But they could lose it all after accidentally building on the wrong block.

title.children: Couple risk losing home after accidentally building on wrong block

image.altText: A woman with short, brown hair wears a grey blazer and carries a manilla folder full of papers

props.synopsis:
Dame Stella Rimington, the first woman to lead the UK's domestic secret service and the person believed to have inspired Judy Dench's characterisation of fictional spymaster M in the James Bond movies, has died.

¬†

title.children: Britain's first female spy boss dies aged 90

image.altText: A close up of Anthony Albanese, looking slightly stern as he talks.

props.synopsis: Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas tells Prime Minister Anthony Albanese that Australia could play an "important role" in achieving peace by joining others to recognise the state of Palestine.

title.children: PM speaks with Palestinian Authority in rare phone call

image.altText: GettyImages-2224232921

props.synopsis: Melbourne fans will hope the removal of Simon Goodwin will help lead the club back to its golden glow ‚Äî but it is never that simple.

title.children: Goodwin sacking is just one step in redeeming Melbourne's golden glow

image.altText: A sign with the ad campaign tagline and a picture of sydney sweeney

props.synopsis: The US president throws his support behind the ad campaign, which faces mixed reviews online and is accused of alluding to theories of racial superiority.

title.children: Trump says 'Go get 'em' to Sydney Sweeney and 'fantastic' ad campaign

image.altText: Two lead smelters side by side in a composite image

props.synopsis: The owner of the Port Pirie and Hobart smelters says it has reached an agreement with the federal and state governments for $135 million in "transitionary support" for its metals manufacturing business.

title.children: Nyrstar to get $135 million bailout for struggling smelters

image.altText: March for Humanity protesters on sydney harbour bridge

props.synopsis: The NSW premier has said publicly that he doesn't regret his opposition to Sunday's protest. He will face caucus today knowing several colleagues marched.

title.children: Court ruling in favour of bridge march created bigger dilemma for Minns

image.altText: People are seen swimming in North Sydney Olympic Pool in Sydney

props.synopsis: The renovation of North Sydney Olympic Pool, located on the shores of Sydney Harbour, has taken three years longer than expected and is more than $60 million over budget.

title.children: The iconic Sydney pool and its jaw-dropping $122 million price tag

image.altText: A police officer with arms out in front and a person in black jumper falling.

props.synopsis: New South Wales Police says it's reviewing a video circulating on social media which allegedly shows a police officer pushing a woman who then hits her head as she falls to the ground.¬†

title.children: Video allegedly shows police officer pushing woman who hits head on post

image.altText: A greenspace. Tall city buildings are visible beyond the park's trees, in the distance.

props.synopsis: An application to prevent the development of a 63,000-seat Olympic stadium at Brisbane's Victoria Park has been lodged with the federal government.

title.children: First Nations group launches bid to halt Olympic stadium plan

image.altText: Alex Zverev waves at the crowd after winning a match at the Canadian Open.

props.synopsis: After beating Australian defending champion Alexei Popyrin in the Canadian Open quarterfinals, top seed Alexander Zverev waves goodbye to a heckling fan in the stands.

title.children: Zverev returns serve at heckler after beating Aussie Popyrin in Toronto

image.altText: Picture of stock market board with ASX sign at the top left corner.

props.synopsis: Stock markets are overcooked and operating dangerously close to the Sun, writes Ian Verrender.¬†

title.children: Awash with cash, the investment world is feeding upon itself

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large green numbers, showing the price of shares which have risen.

props.synopsis: The local share market has lifted more than 1 per cent, with all sectors gaining ground. Wall Street rallied overnight with key indices up between 1.5 and 2 per cent. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Australian stock market gains 1pc in broad rally

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: IDP Education share price jumps 5.7% after cap on foreign student numbers lifted
Are Australian consumers finally springing back into action?
Why did NBN Co go with Amazon's satellite over Elon Musk's starlink?

image.altText: abbott

props.synopsis: Republican Governor Greg Abbott has ordered authorities to arrest the dozens of Texas Democrats who fled the state to successfully block a vote on a Republican plan to redraw the state's congressional districts.

title.children: Texas governor orders arrest of Democrats who fled Texas

image.altText: A sign reads "Forensic Science Queensland".

props.synopsis: It's the second damning report into Queensland's state-run forensics lab to be released in as many days.

title.children: Toxic culture at Qld's forensics lab laid bare in second damning report

image.altText: Police tape with police vehicles in the background of a suburban area.

props.synopsis: Police say two teenage girls were on exchange from China when one allegedly fatally stabbed the other near Newcastle.

title.children: Chinese exchange student arrested over fatal stabbing of 14yo compatriot

image.altText: JCU logo on the side of a university campus building with a plant in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A Queensland university suspends a medical student after he was sentenced for domestic violence, following community outcry for the university to act.

title.children: Queensland university suspends medical student for domestic violence

image.altText: Police taking photos of the off road motorbike with a police motorcycle nearby

props.synopsis: A teenage boy accused of killing a Perth woman while riding a high-powered electric motorbike is released from custody.

title.children: Teen gets bail over fatal e-motorbike crash, is banned from e-rideables

image.altText: Jessica Seaborn, a young woman smiling, long brown hair, green top, leaning on desk

props.synopsis: Author Jessica Seaborn was inspired to write about friendships after mulling over how difficult it is to make friends in adulthood. Her new novel Isn't It Nice We Both Hate the Same Things is a story about best friends, losing friends and making new friends ‚Äî if only it was so easy to find them.

title.children: Author inspired to write about adult friendships and how difficult it is to make new ones

image.altText: A man stands by a fence smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Newly elected Shooters, Fishers and Farmers MP Carlo Di Falco says gun law reform will be one of his bargaining chips when he negotiates support for Tasmania's next government.

title.children: New Tasmanian MP says gun law reform a priority for crossbench deal

image.altText: A stony-faced Combs poses for photos on a red carpet

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs loses a bid to be released from jail ahead of his sentencing on October 3.

title.children: Sean 'Diddy' Combs loses bid to get out of jail prior to sentencing

image.altText: Kate May walks down a footpath with her small black dog.

props.synopsis: A new survey has revealed the prevalence of migraines is far worse in Australian women than experts previously estimated.

title.children: 'Not just a bad headache': Migraine hits millions of Australian women

image.altText: A number of cans of energy drinks.

props.synopsis: As cases of blood toxicity from vitamin B6 continue to rise doctors raise concerns about the level of the product in food and especially energy drinks.

title.children: 'It's vitamin B6': Damage being caused by toxicity spreads to more products

image.altText: A brown chicken on a farm looking at the camera side on.

props.synopsis: The ATO challenges research and development tax offset claims made by prominent poultry producer Ingham's, with tens of millions of dollars involved.¬†

title.children: Multi-million-dollar dispute pits major chicken brand against the tax office

image.altText: Two selfies of an older man with white hair, stubble and bulging fake eye.

props.synopsis: The work of artificial eye maker Jack McDonald is again in question after more people come forward complaining about the eyes he has made for them.

title.children: 'My wife was crying': More complaints against prosthetic eye maker

image.altText: A man with a long beard poses for a photo while seated outside, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: More than two years after Chris Minns pledged to "declare war" on toll road administration fees, his government has yet to fulfil its promise to reduce the fees that toll road operators levy on drivers who fail to pay to use their roads.

title.children: 'Losing a lot of sleep': Motorists demand NSW toll road fee reform

image.altText: Tesla Powerwalls installed at a home.

props.synopsis: After surrendering its dominance of Australian electric vehicle sales, Tesla is also now also rapidly losing ground in the home battery market.

title.children: Tesla 'brand destruction' could cost it millions as battery sales boom

image.altText: Travis Boak celebrates by punching his right fist in the air and yelling with delight to the crowd

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide great, and three-time All-Australian, Travis Boak has announced his retirement from the AFL

title.children: Port Adelaide great Travis Boak announces retirement from AFL
